item.title: [PI] ::spec for donators only
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("spec") && (c.playerRights == DONATOR ID)) { if (!c.inWild()) c.specAmount = 10.0; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::spec for donators only
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:6, topic:384875”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=480641.msg3519233#msg3519233 date=1299279674]

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:353: operator ! cannot be applied to int if (playerCommand.equals("spec") && !c.playerRights == 0 ) { ^

Remove the !.. it isn’t used for that kind of commands in [PI]

What?

@op:

                        if (playerCommand.equals("spec")) {
                                if (!c.inWild())
                                if (c.playerRights != 0)
                                        c.specAmount = 10.0;
                                c.sendMessage("@red@Here you go sir, enjoy. All I ask is to not abuse this. Do not spec and run.");
                        }

How didn’t I see that >.<
I just used the != operator
[/quote]

xD I’m pretty sure you would have fixed this anyways try this

item.title: [PI] ::spec for donators only
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Sorry, I’m feeling like an idiot right now.

Here’s my command…

			if (playerCommand.equals("spec") && !c.playerRights == 0) {
				if (!c.inWild())
					c.specAmount = 10.0;
				c.sendMessage("@red@Here you go, enjoy. All I ask is to not abuse this. Do not spec and run.");
			}

That didn’t work, so I tried…

			if (playerCommand.equals("spec")) {
				if (!c.inWild())
                                if (!c.playerRights == 0)
					c.specAmount = 10.0;
				c.sendMessage("@red@Here you go sir, enjoy. All I ask is to not abuse this. Do not spec and run.");
			}

Gave me another error…
What I’m trying to do is make this command for donators only, that way I might make 2 extra donations of $5.

If you can help me, thank you.

Read full topic
